result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony H. Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs and surcharges by 3/30/15.  If not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (22 pages) commencing JANUARY 29, 2015 received and filed.kl

Defendant Anthony H. Jackson in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Anthony H. Jackson in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS, with credit for 266 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
*Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs 3.30.15 or a civil judgment is not ordered.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 30.30.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

On State's motion, Court ordered Use of a Dangerous Weapon enhancer DISMISSED.
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  PSI was not ordered. Case set for sentencing on 1.29.15.

Defendant Anthony H. Jackson in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Anthony H. Jackson in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Case called and passed until 1:30 pm.
State filed witness list; jury instructions.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton via speaker phone, in court, defendant Anthony H. Jackson not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. out ill.  Case remains on for jury trial in branch 47.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Anthony H. Jackson not in court, in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case was set for a plea hearing; defendant now wants a jury trial.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 10-23-2014 and for jury trial on 12-1-2014 in Branch 47.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 10-23-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony H. Jackson in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Anthony H. Jackson in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Case was calendared for plea this date.  Defense request for an adjourned plea date allowing time to meet with the defendant is granted by the court.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47.  Plea hearing scheduled for 09-08-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony H. Jackson not in court, defendant in custody.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Attorney Shelton phoned the court and stated she had car trouble on todays date. Case rescheduled for PROJECTED PLEA on 8/27/2014 at 8:30 am.   Parties advised effective August 2, 2014, this case will be reassigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47, Room 629 of the Courthouse.

Attorney Danielle L Shelton in court, defendant Anthony H. Jackson not in court, in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 7/15/2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Defendant Anthony H. Jackson in court with attorney Danielle L Shelton.  Defendant Anthony H. Jackson in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Lori M. and Dominic M. as well as the address of 9665 W. Fond du lac Ave., Milwaukee, WI.

Defendant Anthony H. Jackson in court with attorney J. D Thornton.  Defendant Anthony H. Jackson in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
